definition: to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]
footprint/mark/trace/vestige/sign/indication/Taiwan pr. [ji1]
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]

sentences.english: A great number of the Nationalist Party leaders came from Guangdong Province, the cradle of the party.
sentences.chinese: 国民党发迹于广东，也造就了大批粤籍党国领袖。

sentences.english: In Green's invective there is the starveling author's jealousy of the prosperous actor.
sentences.chinese: 格林的痛骂声里包含潦倒作家对发迹演员的嫉妒。

sentences.english: He thrived on the adulation of his henchman.
sentences.chinese: 他靠下属的奉承而发迹。

sentences.english: Mr.Smith began in a small way and piked along.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生开始小本经营而后发迹。

sentences.english: Three young women come to postwar New York to make their fortune.
sentences.chinese: 三个年轻女子来到战后的纽约寻找发迹致富的机会。

sentences.english: The impossibility of growing great under Monseigneur Bienvenu was so well understood.
sentences.chinese: 大家都觉得在卞福汝主教跟前没有发迹的可能。

sentences.english: He rose [made a career for himself] by dealing in munitions.
sentences.chinese: 他是靠贩卖军火发迹的。

sentences.english: However, some musicians have come from the army.
sentences.chinese: 然而呢，一些艺人是在军队中发迹。

sentences.english: The Britishness is an accident of history.
sentences.chinese: 麦尔家族在英国的发迹则是一个历史的巧合。

sentences.english: Some tribes used it in their headdresses and necklaces.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落的人把爆米花装饰在发迹和项链上。

sentences.english: The bureaucratic capital is one of the main capital sources to help salt merchants gain fame and fortune in Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 清代官僚资本是盐商发迹的主要资本来源之一。

sentences.english: Advertising is at the heart of most internet success stories.
sentences.chinese: 广告是许多网站发迹的心脏。

sentences.english: Pursuit for reform is the drive for Huizhou merchants to gain fame and fortune, and the key to their prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 思变是徽商发迹的源泉，是徽商兴盛的奥妙所在。

definition: to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
early years/adolescence
illustrious/celebrated
distinguished or prominent family/influential clan (old)
enormous sum/millionaire/very rich
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
high official
to come down in the world (idiom)/to suffer a reversal of fortune
to flourish/to thrive
to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
to take up an official post
